purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of probability distribution. Probability distribution provides the basic capability needed to mathematically describe a probability distribution. It does not provide a means to exchange the formulae used in the calculation of probabilities, such as the cumulative distribution function or the density function. However, in the case of well known distributions, such as the Normal (or Gaussian) distribution, it does provide the ability to record the parameters of the distribution. It also allows for empirically derived distributions.
This edition incorporates modifications to the previous edition listed below.
The following MIM EXPRESS data USE FROM has been modified:

ul.li: list_representation_item and set_representation_item added to the list for USE FROM representation_schema.

inscope.li: the identification and description of a probability distribution;
the specification of the mean and variance of a probability distribution ;
the association of additional numerical parameters with a probability distribution;
the specification of an empirically derived probability distributions.

outscope.li: the specification of equations for distribution functions;
the specification of particular values of probability;

definition.def: a general term for a function that relates all possible outcomes of an observation on a given system with the probability of their occurring
the quantity observed to vary randomly the number of heads in a coin tossing experiment. the observed length of a component.
